Strong experimental evidence supports the presence of
secreted Dscam1 isoforms in the extracellular region,
particularly in hemolymph where they function as immune
recognition molecules binding to bacterial surfaces.
While this specific reference is about Dscam2, the plasma
membrane localization of Dscam1 is well-supported by other
Dscam1 functions primarily in self-recognition leading to
repulsion/avoidance rather than adhesion. More specific
homophilic cell adhesion via plasma membrane adhesion
molecules (GO:0007156) with repulsive outcome would be
While correct, this term is overly broad. Experimental
evidence supports more specific developmental processes
which are already annotated with experimental evidence.
Redundant with the more specific and accurate plasma
Direct structural evidence demonstrates homophilic binding
through a symmetric dimer interface. This isoform-specific
self-binding is the molecular basis for self-recognition
and is absolutely central to Dscam1 function.
Redundant parent term. Dscam1 is specifically localized to
axons and dendrites which are already annotated with
Direct experimental observation confirms Dscam1 presence
on neuron projections. This parent term encompasses the
Experimental evidence supports cell body localization,
though the neuronal cell body annotation is more commonly
used and has direct experimental support.

essential for proper morphogenesis of both axons and
Multiple independent studies confirm this core function.

Well-validated function showing Dscam1 guides axon branch
No clear evidence that Dscam1 is directly involved in
mechanosensory transduction. Its role in sensory neurons
than in sensory signal detection. The cited paper focuses
While Dscam1 mutants do show ventral cord defects, this is
secondary to its primary role in axon guidance. The
defects in ventral cord organization result from
misguidance of axons rather than a specific developmental
Multiple independent studies confirm this essential
Direct experimental evidence confirms cell body
localization as part of overall neuronal surface
Strong experimental evidence supports Dscam1 role in
regulating multiple aspects of axon development including

Valid immune function but not the primary role of Dscam1.
The secreted isoforms do bind bacteria as opsonins, but
this is a specialized function in hemocytes/fat body, not
Valid but non-core function. Secreted Dscam1 isoforms do
detect and bind bacteria in the immune system, but this is
secondary to the primary neural development roles.
Valid subprocess of the well-established axon guidance
function. Dscam1 signaling through Dock/Pak drives growth
through self-avoidance. The term axon defasciculation or
regulation of axon fasciculation would be more accurate.
True but overly broad. The specific neural development
processes (axon guidance, dendrite morphogenesis) are more

This molecular function is central to its role.
The cited paper does not appear to be primarily about

Valid immune function but not the primary role. The
phagocytosis enhancement through bacterial opsonization is
